title: Cassiopeia got nerfed again before Zed.
body:
12% less bonus AP late-late game.

That's a lot.  With her numbers, probably over 100 AP.

Zed, on the other hand, might get one less auto attack in before his ulti proc kills you.

Favoritism should never exist in the balance department

replies.body: The attack speed nerf was to prevent him from killing your Inner Turret in a single creep wave.

> [{quoted}](name=Devi Freak Mint,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=W1Gc2BEY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-25T01:26:57.492+0000)
>
> The attack speed nerf was to prevent him from killing your Inner Turret in a single creep wave.

Cause that's what people found most annoying about him. Not the manaless free escapes and  near insta-nuke ult plus a passive that forces you to rush zhonyas.

What does he do past 20 min?

He sits in a lane split pushing hoping someone will be dumb enough to try to duel him.

> 
> He sits in a lane split pushing hoping someone will be dumb enough to try to duel him.

Well that's one way of playing him but a good zed can go with his team and wait for the engage then assonate the back line. Split pushing with him is done after he wins mid lane because of his easy early game.

He works as a split pusher, he works in pick comps. He does a pretty decent job at cleaning up.

But a team with Zed will always lose a straight up 5v5 if they don't start with an advantage.

> 
> But a team with Zed will always lose a straight up 5v5 if they don't start with an advantage.

True enough. I'm just saying that Cass doesn't deserve any form of nerfs and that there are worse offenders. Also Zed has been in the spotlight in normal gameplay and LCS for quite a long time and, as I believe Phreak once posted "The Pro players pick champions that are bullshit (strong)."

The whole Cass nerf is a whole different issue.

The nerf happened in 5.5 (this patch) and nobody seemed to have noticed until the patch notes were released. After what people are calling a crippling nerf, her Plat+ win rate actually went up by 0.2%.

Maybe the meta is favoring her. Maybe people didn't reach that absurd level of AP often enough for it to make a difference. I don't know. But her win rate didn't move.
It isn't a nerf more as a bug fix. The bug should never had existed in the first place and it won't kill her too much to have less ap. She still can get 500-600 easily.

500-600 ap are nothing on her as long as she has those godawful ratios. She needs AT LEAST 700-800 ap just to get even with her pre-rework self, she's that weak now. That's a mathematically proven fact and CANNOT be denied.

The rework itself was one of the biggest nerfs she could have asked for.
You must be slightly blind considering how easily I've melted with Cass...? The numbers might look small I guess, but when her E can pump out over like... 1k damage with ease... oh well.

> [{quoted}](name=ScurvyNave,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=W1Gc2BEY,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-03-25T01:34:37.665+0000)
>
> Cause that's what people found most annoying about him. Not the manaless free escapes and  near insta-nuke ult plus a passive that forces you to rush zhonyas.

Manaless != resourceless

If he is careless with his abilities, Zed can easily not have enough energy to make his escape.

Also, his ult is not an insta-nuke, it's a multiplier of the damage that he does while the enemy is marked. The base damages for his abilities are actually lower than most burst champions. His damage is largely a sum of parts, rather than faceroll the keyboard to win type burst patterns like Talon or Annie.

>manaless

He uses energy and has to manage it all game long, not just early game.

>free escapes 

One, single.  His other "escape" requires him to blow his ult, go melee range to a predictable location (right behind his target).  Cooldown 120 / 100 / 80

>near insta-nuke ult

There is 3 seconds between his ult being procced and the mark popping for damage.  During that time he has to blow the rest of his damage or else his ult does as much as a single auto attack.  100% AD + 20 / 35 / 50% of damage dealt

>plus a passive that forces you to rush zhonyas.

Huh?  How does a passive that deals 10% of a targets health as magic damage force anyone to rush Hourglass?

Seriously, nothing you said has any basis in reality. =/

1) Energy management for Zed? seriously? are you kidding me?
2) Still has 2 (Ult + W) Very few champs have 2 escapes and those champs that does have been severely nerfed in damage (see Fizz and Leblanc 5.6)
3) The 3 seconds is the problem. The amount of damage he can output in 3 seconds is ridiculous.
4) He obviously meant ult not passive. 

The only reason I think Zed is untouched is because the balance team thinks he has counter play via rushing zhonyas/QSS. What they don't get is the fact that the champions that do get them are severely gutted in damage (see TSM vs CLG). There are very few champs who can actually afford rushing zhonyas (Lissandra, Vladimir).

One way to balance him is to have QSS NOT remove his ult and reduce his AD ratios in his Q and E. An assassin this mobile should not be able to farm as easy.

of course, you could still stay on the board for more QQ, but i think learning how to play better is far more productive.

Sure he could try to shadow in and trade some, but it cost him heavy in the attempt, and no, W-Q isn't a great way to try and poke your opponent out of lane, ask any Zed and they will laugh their butt off.  

Since Riot has made it clear that they don't want mages picking up a single item to negate their mana costs then they still have a little work to do with Zed.  I.E. put a dent into his early game, lower his early game base damages in return for slightly increased scalings so his late game damage doesn't suffer.  This and possibly up his early game energy costs on Q would more than amply whittle down his early game and allow mages to again go toe to toe with him.

Your comparison is kind of asinine considering Kennen and Zed fulfill two entirely different roles. I dislike Zed, and Kennen is one of my favorites (he was my main in S2 when I first started), but even I find this just ridiculous.

Zed does not bring AOE stuns. That is the single difference that justifies everything you mentioned. Kennen's teamfighting is leagues and miles ahead of Zeds. Kennen has insane amounts of utility - and he brings some damn good damage with it too. 

I'm not sure why you point out that Kennen has to blow his escape to waveclear effectively when Zed has to literally do the exact same thing. Zeds W is his escape. He has to use it to clear waves. 

Kennens Q would be completely and utterly broken if it had the hitbox of Zeds Q or passed through units. For one, Zed has to use TWO abilities for his Shuriken to have 900 range, Kennens Q simply already has huge range. For two, if Kennen hits you with his Q, he can then hit you with his W, which goes over minions and except for going untargetable cannot be dodged whatsoever. 

Finally, Kennen may be ranged, but he builds defensive items because his teamfighting involves freaking charging into the middle of the enemy team and trying to stun as many people as you can. Arguing that Kennen building defensive items is somehow a disadvantage compared to Zed makes no sense. Zed doesn't build very many defensive items because he has no utility to deliver, the only contribution he has in teamfights is his raw damage output. There are very few assassins in the game that have any reason to build more than 2 defensive items. Kennen, by contrast, delivers very significant AOE damage (which is much stronger than Zeds own AOE), and also delivers teamwide stuns. Kennen is not an assassin, he's a utility mage. Therefore, he benefits greatly from surviving in order to get off as many stuns as possible.
